One movie that could be recommended is "Titanic". This classic romance film was released in 1997 and stars Leonardo DiCaprio and Kate Winslet.

The plot of the movie follows a young woman named Rose DeWitt Bukater who boards the luxurious, ill-fated R. M. S. Titanic.

Rose meets Captain Edward Smith (played by Billy Zane) and is taken on board the ship.

As the ship sets sail across the Atlantic Ocean, Rose begins to experience feelings of excitement and anticipation.

However, as the ship encounters rough weather conditions, Rose experiences feelings of anxiety and fear.

As the ship continues to travel across the Atlantic Ocean, Rose experiences feelings of sadness and melancholy due to her longing for her home on shore.

However, as the ship nears landfall in Ireland, Rose experiences feelings of hope and anticipation due to her anticipation of seeing her loved ones on shore once again.

1. 'Casablanca' (1942) directed by Michael Curtiz starring Claude Rains, Humphrey Bogart, Conrad Veidt.

This classic film is set in World War II-era France and revolves around the life of an aging cafe owner named Rick Blaine (Claude Rains). The story follows Rick's attempts to evade his former lover and her fugitive husband (Humphrey Bogart), who are trying to find out where Rick has gone after he separates from his wife. 

The film features an incredible performance by Humphrey Bogart, which earned him the Academy Award for Best Actor for the fourth time in his career. The film also features a memorable performance by Claude Rains, who played Rick Blaine with great dignity and poise. 

Overall, 'Casablanca' is a classic film that has stood the test of time and remains one of the most beloved and iconic films ever made.
